description: Comprehensive test cases for LI-RADS (Liver Imaging Reporting and Data System) v2018 calculator covering all categories, size thresholds, major features, and ancillary adjustments

testCases.testName: Not At-Risk Population - LI-RADS Not Applicable
testCases.description: Patient not in at-risk population - LI-RADS should not be applied

expectedOutputs.LI-RADS Status: LI-RADS not applicable - Patient must be in at-risk population
expectedOutputs.At-Risk Criteria: Cirrhosis (non-vascular), chronic hepatitis B, or current/prior HCC
expectedOutputs.Note: LI-RADS should not be used for patients outside the at-risk population

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check high_risk_population = false. Step 2: Return not applicable status as LI-RADS requires at-risk population.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 Guidelines - Population criteria

testCases.description: Patient in at-risk population but study technically inadequate

expectedOutputs.Definition: Image omission or degradation precludes adequate evaluation
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Repeat imaging with adequate technique

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check high_risk_population = true (pass). Step 2: Check study_adequate = false. Step 3: Return LR-NC due to inadequate study quality.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 - LR-NC definition

testCases.description: Unequivocal enhancing soft tissue in portal vein - absolute contraindication to transplant

expectedOutputs.Definition: Definite tumor invasion of portal or hepatic veins
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Multidisciplinary discussion required
expectedOutputs.Diagnostic Criteria: Unequivocal enhancing soft tissue within a vein

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check high_risk_population = true (pass). Step 2: Check study_adequate = true (pass). Step 3: Check tumor_in_vein = true. Step 4: Return LR-TIV category immediately.
testCases.medicalReference: Bae JS, et al. Radiology. 2021;302(1):107-115

testCases.description: 100% certainty benign observation such as simple cyst, hemangioma, or focal fat

expectedOutputs.Definition: 100% certainty benign (e.g., simple cyst, hemangioma, focal fat)
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Return to routine surveillance

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites (at-risk, adequate study, no TIV) - all pass. Step 2: Check benign_status = 'definitely_benign'. Step 3: Return LR-1 category with 0% HCC probability.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 - Definitely benign observations

testCases.description: Distinctive nodule <20mm without major HCC features - high probability benign

expectedOutputs.Definition: High probability benign; distinctive nodule <20mm without major HCC features
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Return to routine surveillance; option for alternate imaging modality

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites - all pass. Step 2: Check benign_status = 'probably_benign'. Step 3: Return LR-2 category with ~14% HCC probability.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 - Probably benign observations

testCases.description: Rim arterial phase hyperenhancement suggests non-HCC malignancy (iCCA, metastases)

expectedOutputs.Definition: Rim arterial phase hyperenhancement suggests non-HCC malignancy
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Biopsy recommended; multidisciplinary discussion

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites - all pass. Step 2: Check indeterminate status and no explicit LR-M features checked. Step 3: Detect aphe = 'rim'. Step 4: Return LR-M category due to rim APHE.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 - LR-M targetoid features

testCases.description: Multiple LR-M targetoid features present - peripheral washout and delayed central enhancement

expectedOutputs.Definition: Malignant features present but not specific for HCC
expectedOutputs.LR-M Features Identified: Rim APHE; Peripheral washout; Delayed central enhancement
expectedOutputs.Differential Diagnosis: Atypical HCC, intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (iCCA), combined HCC-CCA, metastases
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Biopsy recommended; multidisciplinary discussion

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites - all pass. Step 2: Check has_lrm_features = true. Step 3: Collect checked LR-M features: rim APHE, peripheral washout, delayed central enhancement. Step 4: Return LR-M category with feature list.
testCases.medicalReference: Cerny M, et al. RadioGraphics. 2018;38(7):1973-2001

testCases.description: Infiltrative appearance - non-targetoid LR-M feature

expectedOutputs.Definition: Malignant features present but not specific for HCC
expectedOutputs.Differential Diagnosis: Atypical HCC, intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (iCCA), combined HCC-CCA, metastases
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Biopsy recommended; multidisciplinary discussion

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites - all pass. Step 2: Check has_lrm_features = true. Step 3: Only infiltrative appearance checked. Step 4: Return LR-M category with infiltrative feature.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 - Non-targetoid LR-M features

testCases.description: Observation without APHE, under 20mm, no additional major features

expectedOutputs.Major Features: Nonrim APHE: Absent | Size: 15 mm | Washout: Absent | Enhancing Capsule: Absent | Threshold Growth: Absent
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Repeat imaging in 3-6 months (same or alternate modality)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites - all pass, indeterminate, no LR-M. Step 2: Size = 15mm (<20mm), no APHE. Step 3: Additional features = 0 (no washout, no capsule, no threshold growth). Step 4: No APHE + <20mm + 0 features = LR-3. Step 5: No ancillary adjustments.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 Diagnostic Table - No APHE column

testCases.description: No APHE, under 20mm, with washout only - still LR-3

expectedOutputs.Major Features: Nonrim APHE: Absent | Size: 18 mm | Washout: Present | Enhancing Capsule: Absent | Threshold Growth: Absent
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Repeat imaging in 3-6 months (same or alternate modality)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites - all pass. Step 2: Size = 18mm (<20mm), no APHE. Step 3: Additional features = 1 (washout present). Step 4: No APHE + <20mm + 1 feature = LR-3 (need 2 for LR-4). Step 5: No ancillary adjustments.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 Diagnostic Table - No APHE, <20mm requires >=2 features for LR-4

testCases.description: No APHE, under 20mm, with 2 additional major features - upgrades to LR-4

expectedOutputs.Major Features: Nonrim APHE: Absent | Size: 15 mm | Washout: Present | Enhancing Capsule: Present | Threshold Growth: Absent
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Multidisciplinary discussion; consider biopsy or short-term follow-up

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites - all pass. Step 2: Size = 15mm (<20mm), no APHE. Step 3: Additional features = 2 (washout + capsule). Step 4: No APHE + <20mm + 2 features = LR-4. Step 5: No ancillary adjustments.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 Diagnostic Table - No APHE column

testCases.description: No APHE, 20mm or larger, no additional features - LR-3

expectedOutputs.Major Features: Nonrim APHE: Absent | Size: 25 mm | Washout: Absent | Enhancing Capsule: Absent | Threshold Growth: Absent
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Repeat imaging in 3-6 months (same or alternate modality)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites - all pass. Step 2: Size = 25mm (>=20mm), no APHE. Step 3: Additional features = 0. Step 4: No APHE + >=20mm + 0 features = LR-3. Step 5: No ancillary adjustments.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 Diagnostic Table - No APHE, >=20mm requires >=1 feature for LR-4

testCases.description: No APHE, 20mm or larger, with 1 additional feature - LR-4

expectedOutputs.Major Features: Nonrim APHE: Absent | Size: 20 mm | Washout: Present | Enhancing Capsule: Absent | Threshold Growth: Absent
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Multidisciplinary discussion; consider biopsy or short-term follow-up

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites - all pass. Step 2: Size = 20mm (>=20mm boundary), no APHE. Step 3: Additional features = 1 (washout). Step 4: No APHE + >=20mm + 1 feature = LR-4. Step 5: No ancillary adjustments.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 Diagnostic Table - Size boundary at exactly 20mm

testCases.description: Nonrim APHE present, under 10mm, no additional features - LR-3

expectedOutputs.Major Features: Nonrim APHE: Present | Size: 8 mm | Washout: Absent | Enhancing Capsule: Absent | Threshold Growth: Absent
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Repeat imaging in 3-6 months (same or alternate modality)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites - all pass. Step 2: Size = 8mm (<10mm), has nonrim APHE. Step 3: Additional features = 0. Step 4: APHE + <10mm + 0 features = LR-3. Step 5: No ancillary adjustments.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 Diagnostic Table - <10mm cannot be LR-5

testCases.description: Boundary test: 9mm with APHE and 1 additional feature - LR-4 (cannot be LR-5)

expectedOutputs.Major Features: Nonrim APHE: Present | Size: 9 mm | Washout: Present | Enhancing Capsule: Absent | Threshold Growth: Absent
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Multidisciplinary discussion; consider biopsy or short-term follow-up
expectedOutputs.Clinical Notes: Observation <10mm cannot be categorized as LR-5 regardless of other features

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites - all pass. Step 2: Size = 9mm (<10mm boundary), has nonrim APHE. Step 3: Additional features = 1 (washout). Step 4: APHE + <10mm + 1 feature = LR-4 (max for <10mm). Step 5: Note added about <10mm LR-5 restriction.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 - Observations <10mm cannot be LR-5

testCases.testName: LR-4 - With APHE, <10mm, 2+ Additional Features (Max LR-4)
testCases.description: Under 10mm with APHE and multiple features - still capped at LR-4

expectedOutputs.Major Features: Nonrim APHE: Present | Size: 8 mm | Washout: Present | Enhancing Capsule: Present | Threshold Growth: Present
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Multidisciplinary discussion; consider biopsy or short-term follow-up
expectedOutputs.Clinical Notes: Observation <10mm cannot be categorized as LR-5 regardless of other features

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites - all pass. Step 2: Size = 8mm (<10mm), has nonrim APHE. Step 3: Additional features = 3 (all present). Step 4: APHE + <10mm + 3 features = LR-4 (cannot be LR-5). Step 5: Clinical note added.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 - Size restriction for LR-5 diagnosis

testCases.description: Boundary test: exactly 10mm with APHE but no additional features - LR-3

expectedOutputs.Major Features: Nonrim APHE: Present | Size: 10 mm | Washout: Absent | Enhancing Capsule: Absent | Threshold Growth: Absent
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Repeat imaging in 3-6 months (same or alternate modality)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites - all pass. Step 2: Size = 10mm (10-19mm range), has nonrim APHE. Step 3: Additional features = 0. Step 4: APHE + 10-19mm + 0 features = LR-3. Step 5: No ancillary adjustments.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 - 10mm is lower boundary for potential LR-5

testCases.description: Classic LR-5: 10-19mm with APHE and washout - v2018 update allows LR-5

expectedOutputs.Major Features: Nonrim APHE: Present | Size: 15 mm | Washout: Present | Enhancing Capsule: Absent | Threshold Growth: Absent
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Treat as HCC without biopsy; proceed to staging and treatment planning
expectedOutputs.Clinical Notes: LR-5 allows treatment without biopsy per AASLD guidelines; Verify OPTN criteria separately if patient is a transplant candidate

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites - all pass. Step 2: Size = 15mm (10-19mm range), has nonrim APHE. Step 3: Additional features = 1 (washout). Step 4: APHE + 10-19mm + washout = LR-5 (key v2018 update). Step 5: Clinical notes added.
testCases.medicalReference: Chernyak V, et al. Radiology 2018 - v2018 removed US visibility requirement for 10-19mm + APHE + washout

testCases.testName: LR-5 - With APHE, 10-19mm, Threshold Growth Present
testCases.description: 10-19mm with APHE and threshold growth - LR-5

expectedOutputs.Major Features: Nonrim APHE: Present | Size: 12 mm | Washout: Absent | Enhancing Capsule: Absent | Threshold Growth: Present
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Treat as HCC without biopsy; proceed to staging and treatment planning

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Check prerequisites - all pass. Step 2: Size = 12mm (10-19mm range), has nonrim APHE. Step 3: Additional features = 1 (threshold growth). Step 4: APHE + 10-19mm + threshold growth = LR-5. Step 5: Clinical notes added about threshold growth definition.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 - Threshold growth >= 50% in <= 6 months or new >= 10mm

testCases.description: Boundary test: 19mm with APHE and capsule only (no washout/growth) - LR-4

expectedOutputs.Ancillary Adjustment: Upgraded from LR-3 to LR-4 based on ancillary features favoring malignancy

testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 - Marked T2 hyperintensity favors benignity

testCases.description: Conflicting ancillary features (both malignancy and benignity) - no adjustment

expectedOutputs.Major Features: Nonrim APHE: Present | Size: 16 mm | Washout: Absent | Enhancing Capsule: Absent | Threshold Growth: Absent
expectedOutputs.Recommendation: Repeat imaging in 3-6 months (same or alternate modality)

Step 3: Both malignancy feature (HBP hypointensity) AND benign feature (size reduction) present. Step 4: Conflicting features - no adjustment applied. Step 5: Category remains LR-3.
testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 - Conflicting ancillary features cancel out

testCases.description: LR-3 cannot be downgraded further by benign features

testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 - LR-3 is minimum category from diagnostic table

testCases.medicalReference: LI-RADS v2018 - Capsule alone at 10-19mm = LR-4

algorithmNotes: LI-RADS v2018 applies only to patients at risk for HCC: cirrhosis (non-vascular/congenital), chronic hepatitis B, or prior HCC
The diagnostic algorithm is hierarchical: prerequisites -> LR-NC -> LR-TIV -> LR-1/LR-2 -> LR-M -> diagnostic table
Size thresholds: <10mm (cannot be LR-5), 10-19mm (intermediate criteria), >=20mm (simplified criteria)
Major features: nonrim APHE, observation size, nonperipheral washout, enhancing capsule, threshold growth
v2018 key change: 10-19mm observations with APHE + washout now categorized as LR-5 (removed US visibility requirement)
Threshold growth defined as >=50% size increase in <=6 months OR new observation >=10mm (matches OPTN)
At 10-19mm with APHE: washout OR threshold growth = LR-5; capsule alone = LR-4; >=2 features = LR-5
At >=20mm with APHE: 0 features = LR-4; >=1 feature = LR-5
Without APHE at <20mm: >=2 features = LR-4; <2 features = LR-3
Without APHE at >=20mm: >=1 feature = LR-4; 0 features = LR-3
Ancillary features can upgrade by 1 (max LR-4, never to LR-5) or downgrade by 1
Conflicting ancillary features (both malignancy AND benignity) result in no adjustment
LR-M features take precedence over diagnostic table - any targetoid or qualifying non-targetoid feature = LR-M
Rim APHE alone (in major features section) also triggers LR-M classification
